summary: This document outlines the confidential plea negotiation terms for Jeffrey Epstein's non-prosecution agreement with the Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office. It details the state charges he would plead guilty to, the recommended prison sentence, and conditions including waiving appeals and not contesting jurisdiction in potential civil suits by victims. It also states that federal investigations would close upon his state court plea and sentencing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the plea negotiations, agreeing to plead guilty to state charges related to sexual activity with minors and solicitation.

events.title: Epstein Plea Negotiation Agreement
events.description: Confidential terms are outlined for Epstein to plead guilty to state charges filed by the Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office, with a joint recommendation for at least two years in prison and waiver of appeal rights.

events.title: Closure of Federal Investigations
events.description: The document states that upon Epstein entering his state court plea and being sentenced, the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office will close their investigations.

keyFacts: Epstein agreed to plead guilty (not nolo contendere) to state charges including lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors for prostitution, and sexual activity with minors.
A joint, binding recommendation was made for Epstein to serve at least two years in prison without probation or community control.
Epstein agreed to waive all challenges to the information and his right to appeal the state case.
Epstein agreed not to contest U.S. District Court jurisdiction or the victim status of identified minors in any potential civil suits under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.
The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office agreed to close their investigations once Epstein was sentenced in state court.
